intro: Euphrasia pubibunda, commonly known as the pubescent eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, and it is often found in open, sunny habitats. Euphrasia pubibunda is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
